pkgmetadata.longdescription: ======================Django Session Cleanup======================For projects that use the ``cached_db`` or ``db`` session engines, the``django_session`` table can get quite large after a while.Django provides the 'cleanup' management command for deleting expired sessionsfrom this table but you have to either run this command manually orset-up a cron job.Django Session Cleanup provides a periodic task for`Celery <http://celeryproject.org/>`_ that will delete expired sessions.Usage-----1. Run ``pip install django-session-cleanup``.2. Add ``session_cleanup`` to ``INSTALLED_APPS`` in your project's settings.3. Edit or create ``CELERYBEAT_SCHEDULE`` in your project's settings:: from session_cleanup.settings import weekly_schedule CELERYBEAT_SCHEDULE = { ... 'session_cleanup': weekly_schedule }
